phrase_cn: 神的国**近了**
phrase_en: The kingdom of God **is at hand**
trap: Is coming
Is near
Is close
sentence_context: and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand; repent and believe in the gospel.”
nuance_note: At hand (Engiken) 是完成时，表示触手可及的紧迫感，Coming 是将来时。

phrase_cn: 要**舍**命作多人的赎价
phrase_en: To **give** his life as a **ransom**
trap: Price
Pay
Cost
sentence_context: For even the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
nuance_note: Ransom (Lytron) 是特定神学术语（代赎金），Price 只是商业价格。

phrase_cn: 人子必须受许多的苦，被长老、祭司长和文士弃绝，并且被杀害，过三天复活。
phrase_en: that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes and be killed, and after three days rise again.
sentence_context: And he began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes and be killed, and after three days rise again.
trap: must suffer (必须受苦) -> have to endure / certainly experience pain
nuance_note: The Greek word *dei* (必须) conveys divine necessity or destiny, not merely a human obligation or a strong likelihood. '受苦' implies enduring hardship and pain for a purpose, not just feeling bad.

phrase_cn: 若有人要跟从我，就当舍己，背起他的十字架来跟从我。
phrase_en: If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.
sentence_context: And calling the crowd to him with his disciples, he said to them, 'If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.'
trap: 舍己 (deny himself) -> give up oneself / sacrifice oneself
nuance_note: While 'sacrifice' is related, '舍己' (*aparneomai*) specifically means to disown or renounce oneself, one's own will and desires, in favor of Christ's will. It's a radical reorientation of self.

phrase_cn: 他们强迫一个过路人，就是古利奈人西门，亚历山大和鲁孚的父亲，从乡下进城，替耶稣背十字架。
phrase_en: And they compelled a passerby, Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to carry his cross.
sentence_context: And they compelled a passerby, Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to carry his cross.
trap: 背十字架 (carry cross) -> bear the burden / suffer difficulties
nuance_note: Though Simon physically carried Jesus' cross, the act symbolizes identifying with Christ's suffering and impending death, not just any general hardship. It's a literal and symbolic act.

phrase_cn: 耶稣坐下，叫十二门徒来，对他们说：“若有人愿意作首先的，他就必作众人末后的，作众人的用人。”
phrase_en: And he sat down and called the twelve. And he said to them, 'If anyone would be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.'
sentence_context: And he sat down and called the twelve. And he said to them, 'If anyone would be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.'
trap: 用人 (servant) -> employee / helper
nuance_note: '用人' (*diakonos*) implies humble, selfless service and ministry, often in a position of low status, rather than merely a contractual employee or casual helper. It's a core aspect of discipleship.

phrase_cn: 他们就立刻舍了网，跟从了他。
phrase_en: And immediately they left their nets and followed him.
sentence_context: And Jesus said to them, 'Follow me, and I will make you become fishers of men.' And immediately they left their nets and followed him.
trap: 立刻 (immediately) -> very fast / right now
nuance_note: Mark's frequent use of '立刻' (*euthys*) emphasizes the urgency, decisiveness, and supernatural power of Jesus' call and the disciples' swift, unconditional response, not just quickness.

phrase_cn: 耶稣对他说：“你若能信，在信的人，凡事都能。”
phrase_en: And Jesus said to him, 'If you can! All things are possible for one who believes.'
sentence_context: And Jesus said to him, 'If you can! All things are possible for one who believes.' Immediately the father of the child cried out and said, 'I believe; help my unbelief!'
trap: 信 (believe) -> think it's true / agree with
nuance_note: '信' (*pistis*) in this context means more than intellectual assent; it implies active trust, reliance, and confidence in God's power and ability to act, particularly for miraculous intervention.

phrase_cn: 等到为道遭受患难，或受迫害，就立刻跌倒了。
phrase_en: then, when tribulation or persecution arises on account of the word, immediately they fall away.
sentence_context: And since they have no root in themselves, they endure for a little while; then, when tribulation or persecution arises on account of the word, immediately they fall away.
trap: 跌倒 (fall away) -> trip and fall / make a mistake
nuance_note: '跌倒' (*skandalizō*) here refers to spiritual stumbling or apostasy, abandoning one's faith under pressure or persecution, rather than a physical fall or minor error.

phrase_cn: 你的手若叫你跌倒，就把它砍下来。你缺了肢体进入永生，强如有两只手进入地狱，入那不灭的火里去。
phrase_en: And if your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life crippled than with two hands to go to hell, to the unquenchable fire.
sentence_context: And if your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life crippled than with two hands to go to hell, to the unquenchable fire.
trap: 砍下来 (cut it off) -> remove it / discard it
nuance_note: This is hyperbole emphasizing the radical, painful, and decisive action required to eliminate anything that causes spiritual stumbling or leads to sin, even if it means extreme self-sacrifice. It's a vivid call to deny self.

phrase_cn: 耶稣看着他，就爱他，对他说：“你还缺少一件：去变卖你所有的，分给穷人，就必有财宝在天上；你还要来跟从我。”
phrase_en: And Jesus, looking at him, loved him, and said to him, 'You lack one thing: go, sell all that you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.'
sentence_context: And Jesus, looking at him, loved him, and said to him, 'You lack one thing: go, sell all that you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.'
trap: 跟从我 (follow me) -> come with me / go after me
nuance_note: '跟从我' (*akoloutheō*) means more than physical accompaniment; it signifies becoming a disciple, adopting Jesus' way of life, committing to his teachings, and serving his mission, often involving personal sacrifice.

phrase_cn: 你们要因我的名被众人恨恶，惟有忍耐到底的，必然得救。
phrase_en: And you will be hated by all for my name's sake. But the one who endures to the end will be saved.
sentence_context: And you will be hated by all for my name's sake. But the one who endures to the end will be saved.
trap: 忍耐到底 (endures to the end) -> wait until the end / be patient to the finish
nuance_note: '忍耐到底' (*hypomenō eis telos*) implies active, steadfast perseverance and endurance through trials and persecutions, not merely passive waiting. It's a resilient continuance in faith despite suffering.

phrase_cn: 随即从水里上来
phrase_en: immediately coming up out of the water
sentence_context: And immediately coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens being torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
trap: Immediately (Now)
nuance_note: The Greek εὐθύς (euthys), translated as 'immediately', is a characteristic stylistic feature of Mark, emphasizing the swift, urgent nature of Jesus' ministry, not just 'now' but with purpose.

phrase_cn: 随即在安息日进了会堂教训人
phrase_en: immediately on the Sabbath he entered the synagogue and was teaching
sentence_context: And they went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath he entered the synagogue and was teaching.
trap: Immediately (Fast)
nuance_note: The repeated use of 'immediately' highlights the rapid pace and authority of Jesus' actions, indicating a powerful, 'fast' onset of his public ministry.

phrase_cn: 人子必须受许多的苦
phrase_en: the Son of Man that he must suffer many things
sentence_context: And he said to them, “Elijah does come first to restore all things. And how is it written of the Son of Man that he must suffer many things and be treated with contempt?
trap: Deny (Refuse)
nuance_note: Jesus' suffering is a divinely ordained necessity, fulfilling prophecy. Disciples often found this truth difficult to accept, effectively 'refusing' to understand the path of the Suffering Servant.

phrase_cn: 在你们中间，谁愿为首，就必作你们的仆人
phrase_en: whoever would be great among you must be your servant
sentence_context: But whoever would be great among you must be your servant,
trap: Deny (Refuse)
nuance_note: Jesus redefines greatness from worldly power to humble service. This discipleship principle requires a 'refusal' of self-exaltation and a commitment to serving others.

phrase_cn: 你们祷告，无论求什么，只要信是得着的
phrase_en: whatever you ask in prayer, believe that you have received it
sentence_context: Therefore I tell you, whatever you ask in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.
trap: Deny (Say no)
nuance_note: Genuine belief (faith) is essential for effective prayer. A lack of faith can be seen as 'saying no' to God's ability or willingness to answer.

phrase_cn: 信而受洗的必然得救
phrase_en: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved
sentence_context: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
trap: Deny (Refuse)
nuance_note: Belief and baptism are presented as essential for salvation. To 'refuse' to believe is to reject the path to salvation and face condemnation.

phrase_cn: 为我的缘故
phrase_en: for my sake
sentence_context: “But be on your guard. For they will deliver you over to councils, and you will be beaten in synagogues, and you will stand before governors and kings for my sake, to bear witness before them.
trap: Deny (Say no)
nuance_note: Discipleship involves bearing witness to Christ even through persecution and suffering. There will be temptation to 'say no' to Christ to avoid hardship, highlighting the cost of following Jesus.

phrase_cn: 拉着她的手，扶她起来，热就退了，她就服事他们
phrase_en: he came and took her by the hand and lifted her up, and the fever left her, and she began to serve them
sentence_context: And he came and took her by the hand and lifted her up, and the fever left her, and she began to serve them.
trap: Immediately (Now)
nuance_note: An immediate response to healing is an act of service, demonstrating gratitude and restored capacity 'now' without delay, embodying practical discipleship.

phrase_cn: 她血漏的源头立刻干了
phrase_en: the flow of blood dried up immediately
sentence_context: And immediately the flow of blood dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction.
trap: Immediately (Fast)
nuance_note: The instantaneous nature of the healing emphasizes Jesus' divine power and authority, acting 'fast' and decisively in response to faith.

phrase_cn: 凡要承受神国的，若不像小孩子，断不能进去
phrase_en: whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child will not enter it
sentence_context: Truly, I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child will not enter it.
trap: Kingdom is at hand (Coming soon)
nuance_note: Receiving the Kingdom like a child implies humble faith and trust, a 'belief' essential for entry. The Kingdom, though 'coming soon', requires a present, childlike readiness.

phrase_cn: 圣灵立刻把他催到旷野里去。
phrase_en: The Spirit immediately drove him out into the wilderness.
sentence_context: The Spirit immediately drove him out into the wilderness. And he was in the wilderness forty days, being tempted by Satan. And he was with the wild animals, and the angels were ministering to him.
trap: “立刻” (Lìkè) often translated as "now" or "fast," potentially missing the divine compulsion.
nuance_note: "Immediately" (εὐθύς) in Mark often signals divine urgency and the rapid unfolding of God's plan, not merely speed.

phrase_cn: 人子固然要照经上所写的，去受死；但出卖人子的那人有祸了！那人倒不如没有出生。
phrase_en: For the Son of Man goes as it is written of him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been better for that man if he had not been born.”
sentence_context: For the Son of Man goes as it is written of him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been better for that man if he had not been born.” And as they were eating, he took bread, and after blessing it broke it and gave it to them, and said, “Take; this is my body.”
key_term: Betrayed / Goes as written (出卖 / 照经上所写)
trap: “照经上所写的” (Zhào jīng shàng suǒ xiě de) could be misunderstood as passive fate rather than active divine purpose.
nuance_note: "Goes as it is written" (καθὼς γέγραπται περὶ αὐτοῦ) emphasizes the fulfillment of God's redemptive plan through prophecy, not a simple historical event.

phrase_cn: 彼得就对他说：“看，我们已经撇下一切跟从你了。”
phrase_en: Peter began to say to him, “See, we have left everything and followed you.”
sentence_context: Peter began to say to him, “See, we have left everything and followed you.” Jesus said, “Truly, I say to you, there is no one who has left house or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or lands, for my sake and for the gospel, who will not receive a hundredfold now in this time, houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and lands, with persecutions, and in the age to come eternal life.
key_term: Left everything / Followed (撇下 / 跟从)
trap: “撇下” (Piēxià) can be seen as just "giving up" rather than a radical, complete renunciation.
nuance_note: "Left everything" (ἀφέντες πάντα) signifies a costly, comprehensive commitment of discipleship, prioritizing Christ above all earthly attachments.

phrase_cn: 门徒却不作声，因为他们在路上彼此争论谁是最大的。
phrase_en: But they stayed silent, for on the way they had argued with one another about who was the greatest.
sentence_context: But they stayed silent, for on the way they had argued with one another about who was the greatest. And he sat down and called the twelve. And he said to them, “If anyone would be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.”
trap: “谁是最大的” (Shéi shì zuì dà de) might be interpreted as a simple hierarchy dispute, rather than a deeper misunderstanding of Kingdom values.
nuance_note: The disciples' argument about "who was the greatest" (τίς μείζων) reveals a worldly mindset, which Jesus corrects by redefining true greatness as humble service (διάκονος).

phrase_cn: 兄弟要出卖兄弟，父亲要出卖儿女，把他们置于死地；儿女也要起来对抗父母，害死他们。
phrase_en: And brother will deliver brother over to death, and the father his child, and children will rise against parents and have them put to death.
sentence_context: And brother will deliver brother over to death, and the father his child, and children will rise against parents and have them put to death. And you will be hated by all for my name's sake. But the one who endures to the end will be saved.
key_term: Deliver over to death / Hated (置于死地 / 憎恨)
trap: “出卖” (Chūmài) could be softened to mere "betrayal" without conveying the ultimate consequence of death.
nuance_note: "Deliver over to death" (παραδώσουσιν θανάτῳ) underscores the severe persecution and ultimate sacrifice that disciples may face for Christ's name.

phrase_cn: 耶稣却不理会所听到的话，就对会堂主管说：“不要怕，只要信！”
phrase_en: But overhearing what they said, Jesus said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Do not fear, only believe.”
sentence_context: But overhearing what they said, Jesus said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Do not fear, only believe.” And he allowed no one to follow him except Peter and James and John the brother of James.
trap: “信” (Xìn) is often limited to intellectual assent ("know it is true") rather than active, trusting reliance.
nuance_note: "Only believe" (μόνον πίστευε) is a command for active, unwavering trust (πίστις) in God's power and Christ's authority, especially in dire circumstances.

phrase_cn: 耶稣对他们说：“神国的奥秘，只让你们知道；但对外面的人，一切都用比喻。”
phrase_en: And he said to them, “To you has been given the secret of the kingdom of God, but for those outside everything is in parables,”
sentence_context: And he said to them, “To you has been given the secret of the kingdom of God, but for those outside everything is in parables,” so that “they may indeed see but not perceive, and may indeed hear but not understand, lest they should turn and be forgiven.”
key_term: Kingdom of God / Secret (神的国 / 奥秘)
trap: “神的国” (Shén de guó) can be seen as a future, ethereal heaven, rather than God's present, active reign.
nuance_note: The "secret of the kingdom of God" (μυστήριον τῆς βασιλείας τοῦ θεοῦ) refers to the inaugurated reality of God's sovereign rule in Christ, understood only by those granted spiritual insight.

phrase_cn: 耶稣对他说：“我实在告诉你，就在今晚，鸡叫两遍以前，你会三次不认我。”
phrase_en: And Jesus said to him, “Truly, I tell you, this very night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”
sentence_context: And Jesus said to him, “Truly, I tell you, this very night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” But Peter kept saying emphatically, “If I must die with you, I will not deny you.” And they all said the same.
trap: “不认” (Bù rèn) might be understood as simply "not admitting" rather than a strong act of disowning or disavowal.
nuance_note: "Deny me" (ἀπαρνήσῃ με) signifies a public rejection or disavowal of relationship, a severe betrayal of allegiance in the face of pressure.
